item.title: Forget Mac Mini, Dell Intel Core Ultra 5 Slim Desktop Hits Its Lowest Price Ahead of Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
Grabbing a fast, efficient desktop right now doesn’t have to break the bank. Thanks to Early Black Friday Day Deal, you can score one without overspending.

Right now, the Dell Slim Desktop ECS1250 is available for $600 on Amazon, down $150 from its original price. If you’ve been looking to upgrade your work setup for less, this is the right time to make the move. Since the sale event wraps up tonight, you’ve only got a few hours left to make the decision.

See at Amazon

Made for Everyday Use

It’s a tower computer, but without the bulk and noise of traditional options. It runs on an Intel Core Ultra 5-225 processor that is great for everyday tasks like browsing, streaming, work projects, plus some light creative work. There’s 16GB of DDR5 memory to keep everything running smoothly, even when you’re trying to be productive with a whole bunch of apps opened at the same time. It’s basically built for small workspaces, and Windows 11 support means better overall efficiency.

You’re also getting a 512GB M.2 SSD that takes care of both the boot times and storage. This is enough space to house all your favorite apps, documents, and even a bunch of media content, like some movies for when you’re on the road. Expect the system to load fast, and the programs to open without the usual lag. Ports are also plenty to connect all the essentials and then some. This desktop supports up to four Full HD monitors using DisplayPort 1.4a with daisy chaining, or two 4K displays with the HDMI 2.1 and DisplayPort combo.

It’s also built keeping your future needs in mind. The side panel is tool-less and removable, which means you can open it to upgrade components like storage whenever needed. Even better, there’s a hardware TPM security chip for encrypted data protection, and a lock slot for physical security. This is great if you’re going to use it in a shared office space.

Overall, this desktop is ideal for smaller workspaces. If you’re just looking for something that delivers good, reliable performance for your everyday tasks, this machine is an excellent option to consider. The RAM and storage are great on their own, but it also supports future upgrades when needed. This deal brings the price down to $600, but won’t be around for too long.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/prime-members-can-snag-the-dell-slim-desktop-ecs1250-for-580-but-the-deal-ends-midnight-2000633183

item.title: The Super Mario Galaxy Movie Direct Will Probably Reveal If Yoshi Talks Or Not
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo is airing a Super Mario Galaxy Movie Direct this week. It will include the upcoming sequel’s first full trailer. I’m on the edge of my seat wondering how it will deal with Yoshi.

The livestream will be available Wednesday, November 12, at 9:00 a.m. ET for the special Nintendo Direct. “Please note that no game information will be included in this presentation,” the company cautioned. Still, that gives us the rest of the day to wrap our minds around whichever new stars have been cast to bring the latest trip back to the Mushroom Kingdom to life.

Most importantly, the trailer will likely reveal what Illumination and Nintendo have decided to do with Yoshi’s voice. The green dinosaur was teased at the end of the first Mario Bros. Movie with an egg breaking open in the sewers beneath Brooklyn, and has since been all but confirmed via promotional imagery for cookie dough.

But Yoshi is not like most Mario Bros. characters. He’s not humanoid and doesn’t talk in the games. He just shouts “Yoshi!” in an adorable buttercream voice that just melts your heart. That seems like the most obvious approach for the Mario Galaxy Movie, which will seemingly have something to do with the titular plumber and pals exploring new worlds in the stars.

The alternative is that Yoshi talks and sounds human. Despite the horror, that seems like a non-zero possibility. I’m imagining something like Idris Elba’s version of Knuckles in the Sonic movies: a completely earnest delivery in a vaguely cockney accent that is at once both completely bizarre and yet somehow fitting. I would love for Nintendo and Illumination to really go for something wild here.

Give us Nicholas Cage in the role of a lifetime. Even if it’s just him screaming “Yoshi!” every five minutes.



https://kotaku.com/the-super-mario-galaxy-movie-direct-will-probably-reveal-if-yoshi-talks-or-not-2000642905

item.title: Apple AirPods 4 Suddenly Drop to Almost Free, Early Black Friday Strategy or Just a Clearance Move?
item.content:encoded:
We’re still a couple weeks shy of Black Friday and Cyber Monday. While you can expect to find lots of deals over that late-November weekend across consumer tech and pretty every every other category of products, that doesn’t mean you can’t find any lucrative deals right now. The Apple AirPods 4 are just over a year old and are now seeing a pretty significant discount. It’s a great time to pick up a pair if you’ve been holding out. The base model of Apple’s versatile earbuds released at the price of $129. Right now, Amazon has them for 34% off, brining the price to just $85. You’ll end up saving yourself a good $44. If you want to upgrade to the model with support for active noise cancellation, you can expect a 16% discount. That pair normally goes for $179, but the deal ends up shaving off $30 so you only have to pay $149 for a limited time.

AirPods have been around for a while now with Apple adding in some incremental improvements with each generation. The latest version in the Apple AirPods 4 feature a refined contour with a shorter stem and quick-press controls for music. Apple put a lot of focus on all-day comfort this time around.

See at Amazon

Isolate Sound

You can expect better sound quality when it comes to calls all thanks to the new H2 chipset Apple designed. The new chip enables voice isolation to remove background noises. Folks on the other end of the call will be hearing you and only you, even if you’re in a crowded, noisy environment. The AirPods are able to eliminate sounds coming from around you so you come across perfectly clear.

Likewise, you can expect to better audio quality on your end because of the H2 chip. the new acoustic architecture is designed for crystal clear highs and deep bass.

A nice little addition to the AirPods feature set is how the buds interact with Apple’s voice assistant. Sire can now interpret basic gestures such as nodding yes or shaking your head no as a response to question. Not sure which seems weirder though for someone sitting across from you on the subway. You doing that, or you just blankly saying “Yes” or “No” allowed to no one in particular.

Something you can see different between the AirPods 4 and the previous model right away in a side-by-side is Apple has finally done away with the proprietary Lightning port. The case for the AirPods now charge using the now standard USB-C which is a welcome change indeed.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/apple-airpods-4-suddenly-drop-to-almost-free-early-black-friday-strategy-or-just-a-clearance-move-2000642500

item.title: HP 17″ AMD Ryzen 5 Laptop (32GB RAM, 2TB SSD) Is Over 70% Off, Now Part of the Brand’s Best-Selling Clearance Lineup
item.content:encoded:
Black Friday is just around the corner, and early discounts are already dropping in right, left, and center. Those looking to purchase a new laptop for work or entertainment – we’ve got good news.

The 17-inch HP touchscreen laptop, which normally retails for over $3,000, is now going for just $990 on Amazon. That’s an unbelievable 73% discount, but there’s still more. You will also receive a free accessory kit worth almost $200 with your purchase. Of course, like most big deals, this one is also around for a short time, so it’s best to act fast to grab it. We’re expecting the discount to wrap soon, and there’s no telling if it will be back for Black Friday or Cyber Monday.

See at Amazon

Everything You Need to Get Started Right Away

Starting off with the accessory kit; it includes Windows 11 Pro pre-installed, an external optical drive, a wireless mouse, and a cleaning cloth. These are all useful add-ons, but Windows 11 Pro steals the spotlight. This operating system is one of the best ones out there in terms of overall experience. Microsoft has packed it with a bunch of security features, productivity tools, and system management options, making it ideal for work professionals and creatives. It’s also more expensive than the Home version, but you don’t have to worry about that here.

As for the laptop itself, you’re getting a massive 17.3-inch HD+ (1600×900) anti-glare touchscreen that delivers clear, vibrant visuals. Colors will pop while staying easy on the eyes. Touch support makes it easy to scroll, pinch, swipe, and type directly on the screen using your fingertips. You can use it to sketch and even take notes when you’re not feeling like using the keyboard.

There’s also an HP True Vision 720p camera with a physical privacy shutter paired with AI Noise Reduction for better video calls. The battery offers up to 9 hours of video playback, meaning you can go a full day without plugging the laptop in. And when you do need to recharge, it goes from 0 to 50% in just 45 minutes!

Powering the device is an AMD Ryzen 5 7430U 6-core processor with 32GB RAM for faster and more efficient multitasking. The 2TB SSD lets you store all your important documents, media content, and programs with ease. Together, these are enough to help you be productive on your busy days where you need to work with multiple applications at the same time, take back-to-back video calls, create presentations, etc.

We highly recommend grabbing the deal as soon as you can, before the retailer pushes the price up for good.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/hp-17-amd-ryzen-5-laptop-32gb-ram-2tb-ssd-is-over-70-off-now-part-of-the-brands-best-selling-clearance-lineup-2000642456
